self_contained_context.background: The installer needs human-readable error formatting for terminal output. This module provides the [ERROR]/[FIX]/[THEN] structure for actionable error messages.
prerequisites: 01-01: Error Codes Module must be complete
01-02: Context Detector - Terminal/Claude Detection must be complete
self_contained_context.technical_context: Create output_formatter.py with format_terminal_error() function. Use [ERROR] prefix for error description, [FIX] prefix for remediation action, [THEN] prefix for next steps. Support ANSI colors for terminal. Use context_detector to determine output mode.

task_specification.name: Terminal Error Formatting
task_specification.description: Create output_formatter.py with terminal-friendly error formatting. Use [ERROR]/[FIX]/[THEN] structure. Human-readable messages.
task_specification.motivation: Clear, structured error messages help users quickly understand and resolve installation issues without searching documentation.
task_specification.detailed_instructions: 1. Create scripts/install/output_formatter.py with OutputFormatter class. 2. Implement format_terminal_error() with [ERROR]/[FIX]/[THEN] structure. 3. Add ANSI color support for terminal readability. 4. Use context_detector for output mode selection. 5. Create tests/unit/test_output_formatter.py.
task_specification.acceptance_criteria: Terminal error format uses ERROR/FIX/THEN structure; Missing dependency error shows module name in terminal; Permission error provides clear terminal guidance
